description: Number of iterations of Reverse and Add which lead to a palindrome, or -1 if no palindrome is ever reached.
comments: Palindromes themselves are also 'Reverse and Add!'ed !It is conjectured that a(196) = -1 - see A006860, A023108.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..195
Index entries for sequences related to Reverse and Add!
J. Walker, Three Years Of Computing: Final Report On The Palindrome Quest
example: 6 -> 6 + 6 = 12 -> 12 + 21 = 33 is palindromic, took 2 steps so a(6)=2.
mathematica: tol = 1000; r[n_] := FromDigits[Reverse[IntegerDigits[n]]]; palQ[n_] := n == r[n]; ar[n_] := n + r[n]; Table[k = 0; If[palQ[n], n = ar[n]; k = 1]; While[! palQ[n] && k < tol, n = ar[n]; k++]; If[k == tol, k = -1]; k, {n, 98}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 11 2013 *)
